member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Client.ITesselatorAPI
member.summary:
Interface that allows custom model model meshing for items, blocks and entities Texturing crash course: 1. Block, Item and Entity textures are loaded from json files in the form of a CompositeTexture instance 2. After connecting to a game server, the client inserts all of these textures into their type-respective texture atlasses 3. After insertion a "texture sub-id" is left behind in the CompositeTexture.Baked Property 4. You can now find the position of the texture inside the atlas through the Block/Item/Entity-TextureAtlasPositions arrays (teturesubid is the array key)
Shape Tesselation crash course: 1. Block and Item shapes are loaded from json files in the form of a CompositeShape instance 2. A CompositeShape instance hold some block/item specific information as well as an identifier to a Shape instance 4. After connecting to a game server, the client loads all shapes from the shape folder then finds each blocks/items shape by its shape identifier 5. Result is a MeshData instance that holds all vertices, UV coords, colors and etc. for each block 6. That meshdata instance is a) Held as-is in memory for using during chunk tesselation (you can get a reference to it through getDefaultBlockMesh()) b) "Compiled" to a Model for use during rendering in the gui. Model Compilation means all it's mesh data is uploaded onto the graphcis through a VAO and a ModelRef instance is left behind which can be used by the RenderAPI to render it.

member.summary: Culls faces if they are opaque faces adjacent to opaque faces

member.summary: Never culls any faces

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumFaceCullMode.Merge
member.summary: Culls all faces that are adjacent to opaque faces and faces adjacent to blocks of the same id

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumFaceCullMode.Collapse
member.summary: Culls all faces that are adjacent to opaque faces and the bottom, east or south faces adjacent to blocks of the same id This causes to still leave one single face inbetween instead of 2, eliminating any z-fighting.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumFaceCullMode.MergeMaterial
member.summary: Same as Merge but checks for equal material

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumFaceCullMode.CollapseMaterial
member.summary: Same as Collapse but checks for equal material

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumFaceCullMode.Liquid
member.summary: Same as CollapseMaterial but also culls faces towards opaque blocks

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData
member.summary: A bit fat data structure that can be used to upload mesh information onto the graphics card Please note, all arrays are used as a buffer. They do not tightly fit the data but are always sized as a multiple of 2 from the initial size.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.xyz
member.summary: The x/y/z coordinates buffer. This should hold VerticesCount*3 values.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.Flags
member.summary: The render flags buffer. This should hold VerticesCount*1 values.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.Normals
member.summary: The normals buffer. This should hold VerticesCount*1 values. Currently unused by the engine. GL_INT_2_10_10_10_REV Format x: bits 0-9 (10 bit signed int) y: bits 10-19 (10 bit signed int) z: bits 20-29 (10 bit signed int) w: bits 30-31

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.Uv
member.summary: The uv buffer for texture coordinates. This should hold VerticesCount*2 values.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.Rgba
member.summary: The vertex color buffer. This should hold VerticesCount*4 values.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.rgba2
member.summary: The second vertex color buffer. This should hold VerticesCount*4 values.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.Indices
member.summary: The indices buffer. This should hold IndicesCount values.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.CustomFloats
member.summary: Custom floats buffer. Can be used to upload arbitrary amounts of float values onto the graphics card

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.CustomInts
member.summary: Custom ints buffer. Can be used to upload arbitrary amounts of int values onto the graphics card

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Client.MeshData.CustomBytes
member.summary: Custom bytes buffer. Can be used to upload arbitrary amounts of byte values onto the graphics card

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Common.BlockSelection.DidOffset
member.summary: Always false during block use. True during placement if the Position value was offseted. Example: - When trying to place planks while aiming at rock, the Position is the one in front of the Rock and DidOffset is True - When trying to place planks while aiming at tallgrass, the Position is where the tall grass is and DidOffset is false (because tallgrass is replacable)

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager
member.summary: Takes care loading, reloading and managing all files inside the assets folder. All asset names and paths are always converted to lower case.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an asset from given path within the assets folder. Throws an exception when the asset does not exist. Remember to use lower case paths.

member.summary: Retrieves an asset from given path within the assets folder. Throws an exception when the asset does not exist. Remember to use lower case paths.

member.summary: Retrieves an asset from given path within the assets folder. Returns null when the asset does not exist. Remember to use lower case paths.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.GetMany(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns all assets inside given category with the given path. If no domain is specified, all domains will be searched.
member.param: Whether it should load the contents of this asset

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.GetMany``1(Vintagestory.API.Common.ILogger,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Searches for all assets in given basepath and uses JSON.NET to automatically turn them into objects. Will log an error to given ILogger if it can't parse the json file and continue with the next asset. Remember to use lower case paths. If no domain is specified, all domains will be searched.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.GetLocations(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns all asset locations that begins with given path and domain. If no domain is specified, all domains will be searched.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.Get``1(Vintagestory.API.Common.AssetLocation)
member.summary: Retrieves an asset from given path within the assets folder and uses JSON.NET to automatically turn them into objects. Throws an exception when the asset does not exist or the conversion failed. Remember to use lower case paths.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.Reload(Vintagestory.API.Common.AssetLocation)
member.summary: Reloads all assets in given base location path. It returns the amount of the found locations.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.Reload(Vintagestory.API.Common.AssetCategory)
member.summary: Reloads all assets in given base location path. It returns the amount of the found locations.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IAssetManager.GetOrigins

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockShapeSupplier.OnTesselation(Vintagestory.API.Client.ITerrainMeshPool,Vintagestory.API.Client.ITesselatorAPI)
member.summary: Let's you add your own meshes to a chunk. Don't reuse the meshdata instance anywhere in your code. Return false to use the default mesh instead. WARNING! The Tesselator runs in a seperate thread, so you have to make sure the fields and methods you access inside this method are thread safe.
member.param: The chunk mesh, add your stuff here
If you need to tesselate something, I suggest you use this tesselator, since using the main thread tesselator can cause race conditions

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Common.FastEntityAnimator
member.summary: A class to play the right animations at the right time. Must be able to: - Automatically run animations based on each animations EnumEntityActivity - Manually be feed by an Entity to play additional animations Definition of a running animation: - The transformationMatrices for a given frame. Has to be interpolated from - Current 30-fps frame to next frame, depending on the current dt - All currently active animations

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Common.SimpleParticleProperties
member.summary: A configurable implementation of IParticlePropertiesProvider

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Common.Animation
member.summary:
Represents a shape animation and can calculate the transformation matrices for each frame to be sent to the shader Process 1. For each frame, for each root element, calculate the transformation matrix. Curent model matrix is identy mat. 1.1. Get previous and next key frame. Apply translation, rotation and scale to model matrix. 1.2. Store this matrix as animationmatrix in list 1.3. For each child element 1.3.1. Multiply local transformation matrix with the animation matrix. This matrix is now the curent model matrix. Go to 1 with child elements as root elems
2. For each frame, for each joint 2.1. Calculate the inverse model matrix 2.2. Multiply stored animationmatrix with the inverse model matrix
3. done

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.Animation.GenerateAllFrames(Vintagestory.API.Common.ShapeElement[],System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,Vintagestory.API.Common.AnimationJoint})
member.summary: Compiles the animation into a bunch of matrices, 31 matrices per frame.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.BlockBehavior.ShouldReceiveClientGameTicks(Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldAccessor,Vintagestory.API.Common.IPlayer,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumHandling@)
member.summary:
Everytime the player moves by 8 blocks (or rather leaves the current 8-grid), a scan of all blocks 32x32x32 blocks around the player is initiated and this method is called. If the method returns true, the block is registered to a client side game ticking for spawning particles and such. This method will be called everytime the player left his current 8-grid area.
The default behavior is to return true if block.ParticleProperties are set

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.BlockBehavior.OnBlockRemoved(Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldAccessor,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumHandling@)
member.summary:
Always called when a block has been removed through whatever method, except during worldgen or via ExchangeBlock() For Worldgen you might be able to use TryPlaceBlockForWorldGen() to attach custom behaviors during placement/removal
The default behavior is to delete the block entity, if this block has any

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.WalkBlocks(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.Common.Action{Vintagestory.API.Common.Block,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos},System.Boolean)
member.summary: A bulk block checking method. Less overhead than when calling GetBlock(pos) many times. Currently used for more efficient collision testing.
member.param: The method in which you want to check for the block, whatever it may be
If true, the blocks will be ordered by the distance to the center position

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.SetBlock(System.UInt16,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.Common.ItemStack)
member.summary: Set a block at the given position. Use blockid 0 to clear that position from any blocks. Marks the chunk dirty so that it gets saved to disk during shutdown or next autosave.
member.param: If set then it will be passed onto the block.OnBlockPlaced method

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.ExchangeBlock(System.UInt16,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Set a block at the given position without calling OnBlockRemoved or OnBlockPlaced, which prevents any block entity from being removed or placed. Marks the chunk dirty so that it gets saved to disk during shutdown or next autosave.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.BreakBlock(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.Common.IPlayer,System.Single)
member.summary: Removes the block at given position and calls Block.GetDrops(), Block.OnBreakBlock() and Block.OnNeighourBlockChange() for all neighbours. Drops the items that are return from Block.GetDrops()

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.DamageBlock(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockFacing,System.Single)
member.summary: Client Side: Will render the block breaking decal on that block. If the remaining block resistance reaches 0, will call break block Server Side: Broadcasts a package to all nearby clients to update the block damage of this block for rendering the decal (note: there is currently no server side list of current block damages, these are client side only at the moemnt)

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.GetBlock(System.Int32)

member.param: The block ID to search for

member.summary: Get the Block object of for given block code. Returns null when not found.

member.summary: Permanently removes any block entity at this postion. Does not remove it's corresponding block, you have to do this yourself. Marks the chunk dirty so that it gets saved to disk during shutdown or next autosave.

member.summary: Checks if the position is inside the maps boundaries

member.summary: Checks if the position is inside the maps boundaries

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.IsNotTraversable(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if this position can be traversed by a normal player (returns false for outside map or not yet loaded chunks)

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.IsNotTraversable(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Checks if this position can be traversed by a normal player (returns false for outside map or not yet loaded chunks)

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.Commit
member.summary: Calling this method has no effect in normal block acessors except for: - Bulk update block accessor: Sets all blocks, relight all affected one chunks in one go and send blockupdates to clients in a packed format. - World gen block accessor: To Recalculate the heightmap in of all updated blocks in one go - Revertable block accessor: Same as bulk update block accessor plus stores a new history state.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.Rollback
member.summary: For the bulk update block accessor reverts all the SetBlocks currently called since the last Commit()

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.MarkBlockEntityDirty(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Server side call: Resends the block entity data (if present) to all clients. Triggers a block changed event on the client once received , but will not redraw the chunk. Marks also the chunk dirty so that it gets saved to disk during shutdown or next autosave. Client side call: No effect

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.MarkBlockUpdated(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Server side call: Triggers the method OnNeighourBlockChange() to all neighbour blocks at given position Client side call: No effect.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.MarkBlockDirty(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Server side: Triggers a OnNeighourBlockChange on that position and sends that block to the client (via bulk packet), through that packet the client will do a SetBlock on that position (which triggers a redraw if oldblockid != newblockid). Client side: Triggers a block changed event and will always redraw the chunk

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.GetLightLevel(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumLightLevelType)
member.summary: Returns the light level (0..32) at given position. If the chunk at that position is not loaded this method will return the default sunlight value

member.summary: Returns the light values at given position. XYZ component = block light rgb, W component = sun light brightness

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IBlockAccessor.GetLightRGBs(Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Returns the light values at given position. XYZ component = block light rgb, W component = sun light brightness

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldChunk.LightSat
member.summary: Holds 3 saturation bits, the other upper 5 bits are unused. Useful applications for the unused bits: - 3 bits for water level for water permissible blocks, like fences: http://www.minecraftforum.net/forums/minecraft-discussion/suggestions/67465-water-should-flow-through-fences - 1-2 bits Damage value? - 1 bit if the player placed this block or whether it was part of worldgen

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldAccessor.LoadedChunkIndices
member.summary: Returns a list all loaded chunk positions in the form of a long index. Code to turn that into x/y/z coords: Vec3i coords = new Vec3i( (int)(chunkIndex3d % ChunkMapSizeX), (int)(chunkIndex3d / (ChunkMapSizeX * ChunkMapSizeZ)), (int)((chunkIndex3d / ChunkMapSizeX) % ChunkMapSizeZ) ); Retrieving the list is not a very fast process, not suggested to be called every frame

member.summary: Relaxed bulk block access to the worlds block data. You can however use the WorldManager api to get your own instance of a bulk block accessor

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.IInventory.GetBestSuitedSlot(Vintagestory.API.Common.IPlayer,Vintagestory.API.Common.ItemSlot,System.Collections.Generic.List{Vintagestory.API.Common.IItemSlot})
member.summary:
Returns the best suited slot to hold the item from the source slot. Attached is also a weight, indicating how well the item is suited for it. If no suitable slot was found, the weight will be 0 and the slot will be null. A higher weight means the slot is better suited to hold the item. This method does not check if the player is actually allowed to access or modify this inventory.
Weight will be 1 for a default slot that is empty Weight will be 2 for a default slot that can take one or more items from the source slot Weight could be 10 for an empty armor slot and the source slot contains an armor itemtack

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Common.Block.Replaceable
member.summary: A value usually between 0-9999 that indicates which blocks may be replaced with others. - Any block with replaceable value above 5000 will be washed away by water - Any block with replaceable value above 6000 will replaced when the player tries to place a block Examples: 0 = Bedrock 6000 = Tallgrass 9000 = Lava 9500 = Water 9999 = Air

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Common.Block.Fertility

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.Block.ShouldReceiveClientGameTicks(Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldAccessor,Vintagestory.API.Common.IPlayer,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Everytime the player moves by 8 blocks (or rather leaves the current 8-grid), a scan of all blocks 32x32x32 blocks around the player is initiated and this method is called. If the method returns true, the block is registered to a client side game ticking for spawning particles and such. This method will be called everytime the player left his current 8-grid area.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.Block.OnClientGameTick(Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldAccessor,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos)
member.summary: Called evey 25ms if the block is in range (32 blocks) and block returned true on ShouldReceiveClientGameTicks(). Takes a few seconds for the game to register the block.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.Block.ShouldReceiveServerGameTicks(Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldAccessor,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,System.Object@)
member.summary: Called every interval specified in Server.Config.RandomTickInterval. Defaults to 50ms. This method is called on a separate server thread. This should be considered when deciding how to access blocks. If true is returned, the server will call OnServerGameTick on the main thread passing the BlockPos and the 'extra' object if specified. The 'extra' parameter is meant to prevent duplicating lookups and other calculations when OnServerGameTick is called.
member.param: Optional parameter to set if you need to pass additional data to the OnServerGameTick method

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.Block.OnServerGameTick(Vintagestory.API.Common.IWorldAccessor,Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos,System.Object)
member.summary: Called by the main server thread if and only if this block returned true in ShouldReceiveServerGameTicks.
member.param: The value set for the 'extra' parameter when ShouldReceiveGameTicks was called.

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModType
member.summary: Describes the type of a mod. Allows easy recognition and limiting of what any particular mod can do.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModType.Theme
member.summary: Makes only theme changes (texture, shape, sound, music) to existing game or mod assets / content without adding new content or code.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModType.Content
member.summary: Can modify any existing assets, or add new content, but no code.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModType.Code
member.summary: Can modify existing assets, add new content and make use of C# source files (.cs) and pre-compiled assemblies (.dll).

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo
member.summary: Meta data for a specific mod folder, archive, source file or assembly. Either loaded from a "modinfo.json" or from the assembly's .

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Type
member.summary: The type of this mod. Can be "Theme", "Content" or "Code".

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Name
member.summary: The name of this mod. For example "My Example Mod".

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.ModID
member.summary: The mod id (domain) of this mod. For example "myexamplemod". (Optional. Uses mod name (converted to lowercase, stripped of whitespace and special characters) if missing.)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Version
member.summary: The version of this mod. For example "2.10.4". (optional)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Description
member.summary: A short description of what this mod does. (optional)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Website
member.summary: Location of the website or project site of this mod. (optional)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Authors
member.summary: Names of people working on this mod. (optional)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Contributors
member.summary: Names of people contributing to this mod. (optional)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Side
member.summary: Which side(s) this mod runs on. Can be "Server", "Client" or "Universal". (Optional. Universal (both server and client) by default.)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.RequiredOnClient
member.summary: If set to true and the mod is universal, clients don't need the mod to join. (Optional. False by default.)

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.Dependencies
member.summary: List of mods (and versions) this mod depends on.

member.summary: Attempts to convert the specified mod name to a mod ID, stripping any non-alphanumerical (including spaces and dashes) and lowercasing letters.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Common.ModInfo.IsValidModID(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns whether the specified domain is valid.
Tests if the string is non-null, has a length of at least 1, starts with a basic lowercase letter and contains only lowercase letters and numbers.

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI
member.summary: Contains methods to hook into various server processes

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI.GetRegisteredWorldGenHandlers(Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumPlayStyle)
member.summary: Returns the list of currently registered map chunk generator handlers for given playstyle. Returns an array of handler lists. Each element in the array represents all the handlers for one worldgenpass (see EnumWorldGenPass)

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI.CanPlaceOrBreakBlock(Vintagestory.API.Common.CanPlaceOrBreak)
member.summary: Registers a handler to be called every time a player places a block. The methods return value determines if the player may place/break this block.
member.param: Function to register. Required parameters: (int player, int x, int y, int z)

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI.CanUseBlock(Vintagestory.API.Common.CanUse)
member.summary: Registers a handler to be called every time a player uses a block. The methods return value determines if the player may place/break this block.
member.param: Function to register. Required parameters: (int player, int x, int y, int z)

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI.GetWorldgenBlockAccessor(Vintagestory.API.Common.WorldGenThread)
member.summary: If you require neighbour chunk data during world generation, you have to register to this event to receive access to the chunk generator thread. This method is only called once during server startup.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI.MapChunkGeneration(Vintagestory.API.Common.MapChunkGenerator,Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumPlayStyleFlag)
member.summary: Event that is triggered whenever a new column of chunks is being generated. It is always called before the ChunkGenerator event
member.param: For which worlds to use this generator

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI.MapRegionGeneration(Vintagestory.API.Common.MapRegionGenerator,Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumPlayStyleFlag)
member.summary: Event that is triggered whenever a new 8x8 section of column of chunks is being generated. It is always called before the ChunkGenerator and before the MapChunkGeneration event
member.param: For which worlds to use this generator

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IServerEventAPI.ChunkColumnGeneration(Vintagestory.API.Common.ChunkColumnGeneration,Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass,Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumPlayStyleFlag)
member.summary: Vintagestory uses this method to generate the basic terrain (base terrain + rock strata + caves) in full columns. Only called once in pass EnumWorldGenPass.TerrainNoise. Register to this event if you need acces to a whole chunk column during inital generation.
member.param: For which worlds to use this generator

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IWorldManagerAPI.GetBlockAccessor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieve a customized interface to access blocks in the loaded game world.
member.param: Whether or not a call to Setblock should send the update also to all connected clients
Whether or not to relight the whole chunk after the a call to SetBlock
Log an error message if GetBlock/SetBlock was called to an unloaded chunk
If strict, crashes the server if a unloaded chunk was crashed, prints an exception and exports a png image of the current loaded chunks

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IWorldManagerAPI.GetBlockAccessorBulkUpdate(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieve a customized interface to access blocks in the loaded game world. Does not to relight/sync on a SetBlock until Commit() is called. On commit all touched blocks are relit/synced at once. This method should be used when setting many blocks (e.g. tree generation, explosion, etc.).

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.IWorldManagerAPI.GetBlockAccessorRevertable(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as GetBlockAccessorBulkUpdate, additionally, each Commit() stores the previous state and you can perform undo/redo operations on these.

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase
member.summary: These are the stages the server goes through during launch

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.Start
member.summary: Before anything has been initialized (you cannot receive any events at this point)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.Initialization
member.summary: Server only stuff initialized, Serversystems instantatied, now initializing ServerSystems then Mods. Serversystem receive events at this point.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.Configuration
member.summary: Everything initialized, now loading config

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.LoadAssets
member.summary: Mods will be compiled, AssetManager will init all origins and cache assets.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.LoadGamePre
member.summary: All configs loaded, game world loaded by server. Mods receive events at this point.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.LoadGame
member.summary: All configs loaded, game world loaded by server. All blocks are loaded.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.RunGame
member.summary: About to run first game world tick. Spawnchunks get loaded.

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.Shutdown
member.summary: Shutdown has begun

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumServerRunPhase.Exit
member.summary: Shutdown complete

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass
member.summary: The stages a chunk goes through when being created

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass.None
member.summary: Nothing generated yet

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass.Terrain
member.summary: Does not require neighbour chunks to exist. Should generates 3d rock terrain mostly. Default generators by execute order: 0 = Basic 3D Terrain (granite+rock) 0.1 = Rock Strata 0.3 = Cave generator 0.4 = Block layers (soil, gravel, sand, ice, etc.)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass.TerrainFeatures
member.summary: Requires neighbour chunks. Ravines, Lakes, Boulders. Default generators by execute order: 0.2 = Deposits (Ores, Peat, Clay, etc.) 0.3 = Worldgen Structures 0.4 = Above sealevel Lakes

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass.Vegetation
member.summary: Requires neighbour chunks. Default generators by execute order: 0.5 = Block Patches, Shrubs and Trees 0.9 = Rivulets (single block water sources) 0.95 = Sunlight flooding only inside current chunk 0.99 = Snow layer

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass.NeighbourSunLightFlood
member.summary: Requires neighbour chunks. Does the lighting of the chunk. 0.95 = Sunlight flooding into neighbouring chunks

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass.PreDone
member.summary: Requires neighbour chunks. Nothing left to generate, but neighbour chunks might still generate stuff into this chunk 0.1 = Generate creatures

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.EnumWorldGenPass.Done
member.summary: Chunk generation complete. This pass is not triggered as an event.

member.summary: Ability to read, modify game world time

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.Privilege.grantrevoke
member.summary: Ability to add/remove players to player groups and ability to grant/revoke individual privileges. A player can only grant the same or a lower level group and the same or less privileges.

member.summary: Ability to do everything and have all permissions

member.summary: Ability to issue a command for another player (e.g. teleport another player or set another players game mode)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.Privilege.controlplayergroups
member.summary: Ability to join/leave/invite/op own player groups and their chat channels

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.Server.Privilege.manageplayergroups
member.summary: Ability to create/disband own player groups and their chat channels

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI
member.summary: The core api implemented by the server. The main interface for accessing the server. Contains all sub components and some miscellaneous methods.

member.summary: API Component for registering to various Events

member.summary: API Component for access/modify everything game world related

member.summary: API Component for accessing server related functionality

member.summary: API for sending/receiving network packets

member.name: P:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.World
member.summary: API for accessing anything in the game world

member.summary: Sends a chat message only to given player in given groupId

member.summary: Sends a chat message to all online players in given player group
member.param: Custom data to a message to be received by the client

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.RegisterPrivilege(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a user privilege with the server. Is only active for the current server session and lost during a server restart/shutdown, so register it during server startup. New privileges are auto-granted to admins and the server console.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.GrantPrivilege(System.String)
member.summary: Grants privilege to all players connected or yet to connect. This setting is only active for the current server session and lost during a server restart/shutdown.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.RevokePrivilege(System.String)
member.summary: Revokes a privilege that has been previously granted to all players. Does not revoke privileges granted from a group. Does nothing if this privilege hasn't been previously granted.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.GrantPrivilege(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Grant a privilege to an individual connected player.
member.param: Wether to store this privilege permanently. Otherwise only valid for the active server session.
member.returns: False if player was not found

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.RevokePrivilege(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Revokes a privilege that has been previously granted to this player. Does not revoke privileges granted from a group. Does nothing if the player does not have given privilege.
member.param: If true it removes a previously granted permanent privilege. If false it removes a previously granted temporary privilege.
member.returns: False if player was not found

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.AddPrivilegeToGroup(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add given privilege to given group, granting everyone in this group access to this privilege. This setting is only active for the current server session and lost during a server restart/shutdown.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.Server.ICoreServerAPI.RemovePrivilegeFromGroup(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Revokes given privilege to given group, revoking everyones access to this privilege inside this group

member.summary: Implementation of CRC-32. This class supports several convenient static methods returning the CRC as UInt32. From https://github.com/force-net/Crc32.NET

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.Crc32Algorithm.Append(System.UInt32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes CRC-32 from multiple buffers. Call this method multiple times to chain multiple buffers.
member.param: Initial CRC value for the algorithm. It is zero for the first buffer. Subsequent buffers should have their initial value set to CRC value returned by previous call to this method.
Input buffer with data to be checksummed.
Offset of the input data within the buffer.
Length of the input data in the buffer.
member.returns: Accumulated CRC-32 of all buffers processed so far.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.Crc32Algorithm.Append(System.UInt32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Computes CRC-3C from multiple buffers. Call this method multiple times to chain multiple buffers.
member.param: Initial CRC value for the algorithm. It is zero for the first buffer. Subsequent buffers should have their initial value set to CRC value returned by previous call to this method.
Input buffer containing data to be checksummed.
member.returns: Accumulated CRC-32 of all buffers processed so far.

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockFacing
member.summary: Represents one of the 6 faces of a cube and all it's properties. Uses a right Handed Coordinate System. See also http://www.matrix44.net/cms/notes/opengl-3d-graphics/coordinate-systems-in-opengl In short: North: Negative Z East: Positive X South: Positive Z West: Negative X

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.BlockPos
member.summary:
A useful data structure when operating with block postions.
Valuable Hint: Make use of Copy() or the XXXCopy() variants where needed. A common pitfall is writing code like: BlockPos abovePos = pos.Up(); - with this code abovePos and pos will reference to the same object!

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction
member.summary: Used for EvolvingNatFloat value transforms

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.IDENTICAL
member.summary: y = firstval

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.LINEAR
member.summary: y = firstval + factor * seq

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.LINEARNULLIFY
member.summary: y = factor > 0 ? Math.Min(0, firstval + factor * seq) : Math.Max(0, firstval + factor * seq)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.LINEARREDUCE
member.summary: firstval - firstval / Math.Abs(firstval) * factor * seq

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.LINEARINCREASE
member.summary: firstval + firstval / Math.Abs(firstval) * factor * seq

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.QUADRATIC
member.summary: firstval + Math.Sign(factor) * (factor * seq) * (factor * seq)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.INVERSELINEAR
member.summary: firstval + 1f / (1f + factor * seq)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.ROOT
member.summary: firstval + (float)Math.Sqrt(factor * seq)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.SINUS
member.summary: firstval + GameMath.FastSin(factor * seq)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.CLAMPEDPOSITIVESINUS
member.summary: firstval * GameMath.Min(5 * Math.Abs(GameMath.FastSin(factor * seq)), 1)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.COSINUS
member.summary: firstval + GameMath.FastCos(factor * seq)

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction.SMOOTHSTEP
member.summary: firstval + GameMath.SmoothStep(factor * seq)

member.summary: Does linear interpolation on a 2d map for each of the 4 bytes individually (e.g. RGBA color). It's basically a bilinear zoom of an image like you know it from common image editing software. Only intended for square images. The resulting map will be without any paddding (also requires at least 1 padding at bottom and left side)

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.GameMath.CPCatmullRomSplineLerp(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Unlike the other implementation here, which uses the default "uniform" treatment of t, this computation is used to calculate the same values but introduces the ability to "parameterize" the t values used in the calculation. This is based on Figure 3 from http://www.cemyuksel.com/research/catmullrom_param/catmullrom.pdf
member.param: the actual interpolation ratio from 0 to 1 representing the position between p1 and p2 to interpolate the value.
An array of double values of length 4, where interpolation occurs from p1 to p2.
An array of time measures of length 4, corresponding to each p value.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.GameMath.TriangleStep(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a value between 0..1. Returns 0 if val is smaller than left or greater than right. For val == (left+right)/2 the return value is 1. Every other value is a linear interpolation based on the distance to the middle value. Ascii art representation:
1 | /\ | / \ 0.5| / \ | / \ | / \ 0 __/__________\______ left right

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.GameMath.TriangleStep(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Returns a value between 0..1. Returns 0 if val is smaller than left or greater than right. For val == (left+right)/2 the return value is 1. Every other value is a linear interpolation based on the distance to the middle value. Ascii art representation:
1 | /\ | / \ 0.5| / \ | / \ | / \ 0 __/__________\______ left right

member.summary: Same as TriangleStep but skipping the step to calc mid and range.

member.name: M:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.GameMath.DotNetStringHash(System.String)
member.summary: Pretty much taken directly from the string.GetHashCode() implementation, but these methods as the documentation says: "You should never persist or use a hash code outside the application domain in which it was created, [...]." Hence, this is one basic 32bit bit implementation that can be used in a platform independent way.

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.ClampedPerlinNoise
member.summary: Perlin noise of supplied amplitude and frequency. The resulting value is clamped to 0...1

member.name: T:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.NormalizedPerlinNoise
member.summary:
It's generally pretty hard to get a neatly normalized perlin noise function due to the way perlin works (gauss curve) and how random numbers are generated. So instead of trying to find the perfect normalization factor and instead try to perform some approximate normalization this class allows a small overflow and brings it down very close to the [0, 1] range using tanh().
Returns values in a range of [0..1]

member.summary: Generates the octaves and frequencies using following formulas freq[i] = baseFrequency * 2^i amp[i] = persistence^i

member.summary: Select random numbers with numbers near avg being the most commonly selected ones, following a gaussian curve

member.name: F:Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumDistribution.NARROWINVERSEGAUSSIAN

member.name: T:ProperVersion.SemVer
member.summary: Implementation of Semantic Verisoning standard, version 2.0.0. See https://semver.org/ for specifications.

member.name: M:ProperVersion.SemVer.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified string representation of a semantic version to its equivalent.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified string is null.
Thrown if the specified string doesn't contain a proper properly formatted semantic version.

member.name: M:ProperVersion.SemVer.TryParse(System.String,ProperVersion.SemVer@)
member.summary: Tries to convert the specified string representation of a semantic version to its equivalent, returning true if successful.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a valid, non-null SemVer, If the conversion failed, this is set to the parser's best guess.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified string is null.

member.name: M:ProperVersion.SemVer.TryParse(System.String,ProperVersion.SemVer@,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to convert the specified string representation of a semantic version to its equivalent, returning true if successful.
member.param: When this method returns, contains a valid, non-null SemVer, If the conversion failed, this is set to the method's best guess.
When this method returns, contains the first error describing why the conversion failed, or null if it succeeded.
member.exception: Thrown if the specified string is null.

member.name: M:ProperVersion.SemVer.IsValidIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified string contains only valid identifier characters. That is, only alphanumeric characters and hyphens, [0-9A-Za-z-]. Does not check for empty identifiers.

member.name: M:ProperVersion.SemVer.IsNumericIdent(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified string is a numeric identifier (only contains digits).

member.name: M:ProperVersion.SemVer.SplitIdentifiers(System.String)
member.summary: Splits a string into dot-separated identifiers. Both null and empty strings return an empty array.
